entity.name: scope
entity.attr:
Defines component visibility within scope. This attribute must not be inherited. Note, scope attribute can be used for components, that can not be defined in terms of 'declaration' and 'definition'.
Component is visible for outside world.
Component is visible for outside world via private interface.
Component is visible only within library.

entity.name: declaration
entity.attr:
Defines where component will be declared. This attribute must not be inherited.
Component declaration is visible for outside world.
Component declaration is hidden in a correspond source file.
Component declaration is located somewhere.

entity.name: definition
entity.attr:
Defines where component will be defined. This attribute must not be inherited.
Component definition is visible for outside world.
Component definition is hidden in a correspond source file.
Component definition is located somewhere.

entity.name: visibility
entity.attr:
Defines symbol binary visibility. This attribute must not be inherited.
Symbols of the types and methods are visible in a binary file.
Symbols of the types and methods are hidden in a binary file.

entity.name: of_class
entity.attr: Defines class name that a component belongs to. This attributes is used for inner components name resolution.

entity.name: uid
entity.attr: Unique component identifier represents name that uniquely identifies component within models hierarchy.
Unique component identifier represents name that uniquely identifies component within projects hierarchy.

entity.name: lang
entity.attr:
Defines target language this entity is applied to.
C language.
Java language.
C# language.

entity:
Contains language specific implementation body. For instance, method implementation body for C language.
Defines implementation body originator.
Implementation is just a stub, so method must be implemented by developer.
Implementation is fully generated, so it must no be modified within source code.
Implementation was written by developer, so it can be extracted and reused during generation phase. In this way comments and/or entity signature can be changed, but implementation will be untouched.

entity.name: landlord
entity.attr: Defines project name that component refers to.
Defines library name that component refers to.
